column4: i have 4 partions on my harddrive. i have heard that it is impossibel to make more then 4 partions. is that right?
so i cant make any more partitions?
it's impossible to make >4 primary partitions, but if one of them is an extended partition, it can contain as many logical partitions as you want
how can i look if thay are logical then?
even if you have lessa than 4 primary partitions
i have hda1 hda3 hda4 and hda5 so then i can make one more partition?
how? i whant to make an 2 gb partition. it should take the space from hda5.
gparted (or qtparted too i guess) should be able to shrink hda5 to make room for hda6, but you can't do it while hda5 is in use
incidentally, i tried to shrink a partition w/ gparted yesterday but it refused to co-operate, so caveat emptor... also, *take* *backups* ;;)
apt-get install gparted ; it's found in applications-systemtoolssomething-gparted
if hda5 doesn't have _any_ data on it now, that is
actually, you can d(elete) 5 and then create new 5 and 6 in one go
ok, in that case you can try to shrink hda5 with gparted, _in_theory_ that will not touch your data
i'd edit /etc/fstab and copy and existing line
what? i dont understand what you saying.
